page.title: 15Walton in Felixstowe
page.content: {Walton High St.}has a church ,houses and shops along both sides.A new home for the elderly has just been built in the High Street where a garage used to be.In front of St.mary's church is the old hexagonal cage,now used as a bus shelter.The cage used to be a{prison for drunks and thieves.It originally stood in the old market place and the prisoners were lowered through a pointed roof into it.In{Cage Lane}is Bath Bungalow.This was the former {public baths.}On Friday afternoons or Saturdays people could have a hot bath costing 3d.Towels were not provided ,but latterly bath cubes could be bought for 1d.The baths were useful because the old terraced houses had no bathrooms.These old houses have been demolished and new flats and small houses have been built by the council.
